sentances.value: But when Heracles fought with Centaurus, he was shot by a poisoned arrow by mistake.
sentances.en: But when Heracles fought with Centaurus, he was shot by a poisoned arrow by mistake.

sentances.kr: 제우스는 케이론을 기리기 위해 하늘로 올려 보내 별자리로 만들었어.
sentances.value: Zeus made him the star sign to honor.
sentances.en: Zeus made him the star sign to honor.

conversations.speaker: B

conversations.speaker: B

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: First, it's the star sign for Chiron who was half-man and half-horse.

sentances.value: Capricorn is the star sign of the god Pan of livestock.
sentances.en: Capricorn is the star sign of the god Pan of livestock.

sentances.kr: 판이 어느 날 신들의 잔치에서 흥겹게 놀고 있었는데, 갑자기 거인족인 티폰이 쳐들어왔지 뭐야.
sentances.value: Oneday Pan was having a fun at the party of the gods, and suddenly Typhon who was the ogre dropped in without warning.
sentances.en: Oneday Pan was having a fun at the party of the gods, and suddenly Typhon who was the ogre dropped in without warning.

sentances.kr: 신들은 모두 동물로 변해 도망을 쳤고, 판도 염소로 변신해 도망치려고 했어.
sentances.value: The gods all transformed into the animals to run away, and he tried to transform into a goat and run away like them.
sentances.en: The gods all transformed into the animals to run away, and he tried to transform into a goat and run away like them.

sentances.kr: 그런데 주문이 잘못되는 바람에 상체는 염소, 하체는 물고기의 형태가 되고 말았지.
sentances.value: But he said the wrong spell, so his upper body became a goat and his lower body became fish.
sentances.en: But he said the wrong spell, so his upper body became a goat and his lower body became fish.

sentances.kr: 자! 이제 가을이 시작될 무렵이면 남쪽 하늘에서 물고기 꼬리를 뒤뚱거리며 도망치는 염소자리를 찾아볼까?
sentances.value: Well! Shall we find Capricorn that is running away with wiggling a tail of fish in the southern sky in the beginning of fall?
sentances.en: Well! Shall we find Capricorn that is running away with wiggling a tail of fish in the southern sky in the beginning of fall?

title_en: "When you look under the Pegasus carefully, the dark stars are connected each other and make the alphabet ""L""."
title_kr: 페가수스자리 아래를 살펴보면, 어두운 별들이 이어져 L자 모양을 하고 있어.

sentances.value: Aquarius is for the prince Ganymede of Troy.
sentances.en: Aquarius is for the prince Ganymede of Troy.

sentances.kr: 가니메데스는 원래 양 떼 돌보는 일을 하고 있었는데,
sentances.value: Ganymede was working for taking care of sheep,
sentances.en: Ganymede was working for taking care of sheep,

sentances.kr: 독수리로 변한 제우스가 납치해 가서 신들에게 술을 따르는 일을 맡게 했단다.
sentances.value: but Zeus who transformed into an eagle kidnapped him and put him to pour out drinks for the gods.

sentances.kr: 가니메데스가 들고 있는 물병 속에는 언제나 시원한 음료수가 가득 차 있었고,
sentances.value: His liquor bottles always were fulled of cold drinks,

title_en: The star signs in the sky

sentances.kr: 페가수스자리 아래를 살펴보면, 어두운 별들이 이어져 L자 모양을 하고 있어.
sentances.value: "When you look under the Pegasus carefully, the dark stars are connected each other and make the alphabet ""L""."
sentances.en: "When you look under the Pegasus carefully, the dark stars are connected each other and make the alphabet ""L""."

sentances.kr: 미의 여신 아프로디테가 아들 에로스와 함께 강가를 산책하고 있었는데, 어디선가 갑자기 거인족 티폰이 나타났지 뭐야.
sentances.value: When the goddess Aphrodite of beauty was taking for a walk with her son Eros, suddenly the ogre Typhon showed up.
sentances.en: When the goddess Aphrodite of beauty was taking for a walk with her son Eros, suddenly the ogre Typhon showed up.

sentances.kr: 아프로디테와 에로스는 얼른 물고기로 변신해 강물 속으로 뛰어들어 숨었지.
sentances.value: Her son and she transformed into fish, and then jumped into the water to hide.
sentances.en: Her son and she transformed into fish, and then jumped into the water to hide.

sentances.kr: 그 모습을 나타낸 물고기자리는 어머니와 아들간의 보이지 않는 사랑의 끈을 의미한단다.
sentances.value: So, Pisces means the bond of invisible love between mother and son.
sentances.en: So, Pisces means the bond of invisible love between mother and son.

title_en: The new stars in the universe.

sentances.value: The star signs in the sky
sentances.en: The star signs in the sky

sentances.kr: 방향이나 위치를 알 수 있는 도구들이 없었던 아주 옛날에는 북극성을 보고 방향을 알 수 있었어요.
sentances.value: Long time ago, people didn't have any tools for knowing the direction or the location, so they used Polaris to know it.
sentances.en: Long time ago, people didn't have any tools for knowing the direction or the location, so they used Polaris to know it.

sentances.kr: 다른 별들과 달리 북극성은 위치가 거의 바뀌지 않기 때문이지요.
sentances.value: Unlike the other star signs, Polaris barely doesn't change its location.
sentances.en: Unlike the other star signs, Polaris barely doesn't change its location.

sentances.value: The place where Polaris is, is the North.
sentances.en: The place where Polaris is, is the North.

sentances.kr: 북극성을 찾는 방법은 보통 두 가지가 있어요.
sentances.value: There are two ways how to find Polaris.
sentances.en: There are two ways how to find Polaris.

sentances.kr: 북쪽 하늘에서 볼 수 있는 별자리는 북두칠성과 카시오페이아자리인데, 북두칠성을 이용하는 방법, 카시오페이아를 이용하는 방법이 있지요.
sentances.value: The star signs which you can see in the northern sky are the Big Dipper and  Cassiopeia, so there are two ways how to find Polaris, using the Big Dipper and using Cassiopeia.
sentances.en: The star signs which you can see in the northern sky are the Big Dipper and  Cassiopeia, so there are two ways how to find Polaris, using the Big Dipper and using Cassiopeia.

sentances.kr: 참고로 북두칠성은 국자 모양의 별자리이고, 카시오페이아는 W 자 모양이에요.
sentances.value: "The Big Dipper shaped like a ladle, and Cassiopeia shaped like alphabet ""W""."
sentances.en: "The Big Dipper shaped like a ladle, and Cassiopeia shaped like alphabet ""W""."

sentances.value: How to use the Big Dipper.
sentances.en: How to use the Big Dipper.

sentances.kr: 북두칠성의 끝 두 별의 길이를 직선으로 5배 정도 연장하면 그곳에 북극성이 있어요.
sentances.value: When you extend length of two stars which are at the end of the Big Dipper about five times in a straight line, you can find Polaris.
sentances.en: When you extend length of two stars which are at the end of the Big Dipper about five times in a straight line, you can find Polaris.

sentances.value: It's good way that you use in spring and summer.
sentances.en: It's good way that you use in spring and summer.

sentances.kr: W자 모양에서 바깥 쪽 두 개의 별을 연장한 선을 그어 만나는 점을 찾은 후, 그 점과 카시오페이아의 가운데 별과의 거리를 직선으로 5배 정도 연장하면 그곳에 북극성이 있어요.
sentances.value: "After you find the connected point which you find ""W"" and extend the outer two stars to draw line, you extend the distance which is that point and the middle star of Cassiopeia about five times, and then you can find Polaris at that point. "
sentances.en: "After you find the connected point which you find ""W"" and extend the outer two stars to draw line, you extend the distance which is that point and the middle star of Cassiopeia about five times, and then you can find Polaris at that point. "

sentances.value: It's good way that you use in fall and winter.
sentances.en: It's good way that you use in fall and winter.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: So, her son and she transformed into fish, and jumped into the water to hide.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: What's meaning of that star sign?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: It means the bond of invisible love between mother and son.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh, that's good meaning!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: By the way, how did people know the right direction?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: They could find the direction by looking up the sky and finding Polaris.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: How did they do that?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Because Polaris barely doesn't change its location unlike the other star signs.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh really?

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Then how can we find Polaris?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: There are two ways how to find Polaris.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: First, we can use the Big Dipper.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: And what is the other one?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Second, we can use Cassiopeia.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Then, how can we find the Big dipper?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: The Big Dipper shaped like a ladle.

sentances.value: The new stars in the universe.
sentances.en: The new stars in the universe.

sentances.kr: 밤하늘에는 반짝반짝 빛나는 별들이 아주 많아요.
sentances.value: There are lots of twinkling stars in the night sky.
sentances.en: There are lots of twinkling stars in the night sky.

sentances.kr: 그 별들은 모두 이름을 가지고 있지요.
sentances.value: Those stars all have a name.
sentances.en: Those stars all have a name.

sentances.kr: 하지만 우주의 아주 먼 곳에는 우리가 아직 발견하지 못한 별들이 상상할 수 없을 정도로 많이 있어요.
sentances.value: But, there are a lot of stars in the universe that we haven't find yet.
sentances.en: But, there are a lot of stars in the universe that we haven't find yet.

sentances.kr: 천문가들은 뛰어난 성능의 망원경을 이용해 그런 별들을 찾고 이름도 붙여 주지요.
sentances.value: The astronomers give them a name by using the telescope which has high quality.
sentances.en: The astronomers give them a name by using the telescope which has high quality.

sentances.kr: 새롭게 발견된 별은 발견하는 사람의 이름이나 관측한 망원경의 이름을 붙이게 돼요.
sentances.value: The stars that are found newly get a name of person's who find that stars or a name of the telescope that is used.
sentances.en: The stars that are found newly get a name of person's who find that stars or a name of the telescope that is used.

sentances.value: Let's figure out the new stars that have a unique name.
sentances.en: Let's figure out the new stars that have a unique name.

sentances.kr: ‘통일’은 우리나라의 아마추어 천문가 이태형 님이 1998년 9월에 새롭게 발견한 소행성이에요.
sentances.value: """Unification"" is the asteroid that was found by the amateur astronomer Tae-hyeong Lee in September, 1998."
sentances.en: """Unification"" is the asteroid that was found by the amateur astronomer Tae-hyeong Lee in September, 1998."

sentances.value: It's approved by International Astronomical Union(IVOA).
sentances.en: It's approved by International Astronomical Union(IVOA).

sentances.kr: 별은 발견하는 사람이 이름을 붙일 수 있어 이 별은 ‘통일’이라는 이름이 지어 주었어요.
sentances.value: "Stars can be named by a person's name who found the star, so this star was named ""Unification"" because the amateur astronomer Tae-hyeong Lee gave this name."
sentances.en: "Stars can be named by a person's name who found the star, so this star was named ""Unification"" because the amateur astronomer Tae-hyeong Lee gave this name."

sentances.kr: ‘세종’은 일본의 아마추어 천문가 와타나베 가즈오 님이 1996년에 발견한 소행성이에요.
sentances.value: """Se Jong"" is the asteroid that was found by the amateur astronomer Kazuro Watanabe in 1996."
sentances.en: """Se Jong"" is the asteroid that was found by the amateur astronomer Kazuro Watanabe in 1996."

sentances.kr: 평소 우리나라 천문학에 큰 업적을 쌓은 ‘세종대왕’을 존경해서 이 별에 ‘세종’이라는 이름을 지어 주었어요.
sentances.value: Usually, he repected King Sejong who had produced great results in astronomy of Korea, so he gave a name 'Sejong' to this star.
sentances.en: Usually, he repected King Sejong who had produced great results in astronomy of Korea, so he gave a name 'Sejong' to this star.

sentances.kr: ‘이-스완’은 2009년 아마추어 천문가인 이대암 님이 한국인으로는 처음 발견한 혜성이에요.
sentances.value: """Lee-Swan"" is the comet that was found by the amateur astronomer Dae-nam Lee first as Korean in 2009."
sentances.en: """Lee-Swan"" is the comet that was found by the amateur astronomer Dae-nam Lee first as Korean in 2009."

sentances.kr: 이 혜성은 이틀 뒤에 미국의 천문학자가 스완이라는 망원경으로 관측한 자료를 분석하다가 발견하기도 했어요.
sentances.value: Two days later, this comet was found by the astronomer in America as he analyzed the data that were observed by using the telescope named Swan.
sentances.en: Two days later, this comet was found by the astronomer in America as he analyzed the data that were observed by using the telescope named Swan.

sentances.kr: 그래서 두 발견자의 이름을 붙여 ‘이-스완’이라는 이름이 붙게 되었어요.
sentances.value: So, the names of two discoverers was attached to give this name 'Lee-Swan' to it.
sentances.en: So, the names of two discoverers was attached to give this name 'Lee-Swan' to it.

sentances.value: The planet resembling Earth in the universe.
sentances.en: The planet resembling Earth in the universe.

sentances.kr: 관측 기술의 발달로 인류는 새로운 별들을 계속해서 발견하고 있어요.
sentances.value: Man keep finding the new stars thanks for developing the technology of observing.
sentances.en: Man keep finding the new stars thanks for developing the technology of observing.

sentances.kr: 미국항공우주국(NASA)은 지구와 아주 닮아서 생명체가 있을 가능성이 높은 행성을 발견했어요.
sentances.value: NASA found a planet which was high probability that life exist in there because of resembling Earth very much.
sentances.en: NASA found a planet which was high probability that life exist in there because of resembling Earth very much.

sentances.kr: ‘케플러-452b’라는 이름의 행성인데, 케플러라는 관측 장비로 발견했지요.
sentances.value: It's the planet named 'Kepler-452b', and it was found by the telescope named kepler.
sentances.en: It's the planet named 'Kepler-452b', and it was found by the telescope named kepler.

sentances.kr: 지구에서 1400광년 떨어져 있으니, 빛의 속도로 1400년을 가야 할만큼 멀리 있답니다.
sentances.value: It's 1400 light years away from Earth, so you should travel 1400 years away at the speed of light if you want to go there.
sentances.en: It's 1400 light years away from Earth, so you should travel 1400 years away at the speed of light if you want to go there.

sentances.kr: 지구처럼 물과 바위가 있을 가능성이 높다고 해요.
sentances.value: It has high probability that water and rocks exsit in there like Earth.
sentances.en: It has high probability that water and rocks exsit in there like Earth.

sentances.kr: 이처럼 지구와 아주 닮아서 생명체가 살기 좋은 조건을 만족하는 태양계 밖 행성을 발견한 건 처음이라고 해요.
sentances.value: It's the first time that people found the planet outside of the solar system that fulfill the condition for living life because of resembling Earth like.
sentances.en: It's the first time that people found the planet outside of the solar system that fulfill the condition for living life because of resembling Earth like.

sentances.kr: """내가 몸집도 크고 나이도 더 많은 형이라고!"""

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: How can we find Polaris by using it?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: When you extend length of two stars which are at the end of the Big Dipper about five times in a straight line, you can find Polaris.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Also, it's good way that you use in spring and summer.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh, then how can we find Cassiopeia?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: "It shaped like alphabet ""W""."

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: How can we find Polaris by using it?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: "After you find the connected point which you find ""W"" and extend the outer two stars to draw line, you extend the distance which is that point and the middle star of Cassiopeia about five times, and then you can find Polaris at that point. "

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Also, it's good way that you use in fall and winter.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Wow, it's so interesting!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Do the astronomer find the new star signs thesedays?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Of course.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: There are a lot of stars in the universe that we haven't find yet.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: What's the names of new star signs?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: For example, there are Unification, Se Jong, Lee-Swan and so on.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Why are the names so unique?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Because the stars that are found newly get a name of person's who find that stars or a name of the telescope that is used.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Really?

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: How interesting it is!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: If I find a new star, can I give my name to it?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Of couse you can!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Wow, that's so cool!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh, I have one more question.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Is there a planet like Earth in the universe?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: There is a planet named Kepler-452b.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: It resembles with Earth.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Wow, really?

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: How was it found?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: NASA found a planet which was high probability that life exist in there because of resembling Earth very much.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: What's the charicteristics of this planet?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Well, first, it's 1400 light years away from Earth, so you should travel 1400 years away at the speed of light if you want to go there.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh, it's too far away.

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Second, it has high probability that water and rocks exsit in there like Earth.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: That's good to hear that!

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: It's the first time that people found the planet outside of the solar system that fulfill the condition for living life because of resembling Earth like.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: Oh, then if Earth will be collapsed, we can go and live there?

conversations.speaker: A
conversations.value: Maybe, but that is too far away from here.

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: The stars are so interesting!

conversations.speaker: B
conversations.value: I want to know more about them.
